3.24.18  10:37 pm   if i consider myself an optimist, does that make me an optimist?

     if i consider you an optimist, would that make you an optimist

3.24.18  10:05 pm   3.24.18  1:29 am intro to hotewig

     you'll have to give me a little bit of what came before it, i'm not watching the video and i haven't seen it in 10 months. but the beginning of the video attempts to look at it from the perspective of the universe's creation. almost trying to get inside the motivations for creating a universe. it's safe to assume none of the rules of our universe apply there. so that part of the video is just illustrating infinity and what it truly feels like, and trying to imagine some catalyst for getting out of there, despite the fact that anything and everything already had and will happen, so it becomes impossible to make the distinction unless you spontaneously decide to make one up and start telling stories

3.24.18  9:29 pm   how do i remember the notes on a guitar fretboard (quickly, i know how to get them after 15 seconds of counting back, but i want it instant)

3.24.18  11:41 am   3.23.18 4:33 pm So you made the lyrics in 2012 (I checked through expert mode).

     i always write lyrics and music at the same time. the chorus was written in 2012. the first verse was written in 2009, and the remainder of the song was written in 2017

     Does that mean because you made a lot of songs (some were made on 2010 but uploaded on 2013-2016), that you forgot to upload it on YouTube until 2018?

     writing a song just means i know how it goes. that doesn't include recording it, singing it, editing it, mixing it, and then also making an entire video to go with it

3.24.18  11:37 am   Why do you respond to some questions with "i will check"?

     to buy me some time

3.24.18  11:13 am   lmao youtube didn't even get the correct umbrella color right for your vidcon picture thing

     there is no correct color. the umbrellas i use are different colors for each site. the one they've used is the red one on a black background, i think, which is the one i use for twitter

3.24.18  11:12 am   According,to Urban Dictionary, the slang word "slef" is an abbrevation of "Self" which is an abbrevation of "selvfølgelig". The danish word is a translation of the word "of course". The adjective is mostly used by street pimpz from the Aarhus area , Denmark and consists approximately 40% of their vocabulary. Does that mean that your YouTube about page means "is of course"?

     no

3.24.18  11:08 am   3.24.18 7:23 am I checked the featured creators page too. Does that mean that if you're not gonna join VidCon, did someone hack into the page and put your name??

     i accepted the invite weeks ago, the question is what will i do there

3.24.18  11:03 am   3.23.18  9:14 am Here's the proof: 3.22.18 2:00 pm

     that's not proof that i always do it. that's proof that i did it once

3.24.18  10:36 am   Why don't you have an faq or a blog for the common questions asked on this page, like the ones on learning piano?

     it would be difficult to illustrate how common each question is, and there would be a feeling when reading it that i might have just chosen the questions i wanted to put there, in the order i wanted to put them. there is no clear way to decide how to order them, and how to phrase them, because the phrasing would be slightly different each time they were actually asked. so the page would have a very 'composed' feel to it, and it would feel somewhat like i was composing the questions

3.24.18  10:27 am   what's your opinion on vocal synthesizers made for usage in music?

     no opinion

      things like vocaloid, cantor, or alter/ego for example. do you think that they can actually sound like a human if used properly?

     maybe

      or do you think that they never really measure up to that level?

     i don't know too much about it

3.24.18  10:04 am   3.23.18  1:58 pm if it's a good idea to study art which was made by you, then how come you never watch your own videos after making them?

     perhaps i was busy doing another good idea

3.24.18  10:02 am   3.23.18  11:55 am that doesn't answer the question. Does the order in which you answer questions match the order they are sent?

     not always. but if i answer them in a different order it does not affect how they go on the page

3.24.18  9:00 am   3.24.18  7:23 am Why don't you just play some songs? I'm sure you want to save the real crazy live performances for when you have your full band put together and are actually touring.. but hearing some stripped-down keys/voc versions of some of your tunes would be pretty nifty I think.

     so you're saying i should save the real version for later but whip together a less produced version to be on the internet forever

     Or maybe show off some drum parts from your songs (since you never get to play drums in vids)? I feel like doing a Q&A panel thing would be kind of silly, considering you already have this page which is way more crazy and in-depth than any interview or panel could be... I'm sure you'll think of something, I'm just brainstorming here.

3.24.18  8:26 am   Why does my midi keyboard start on F?

     why not

3.24.18  7:43 am   hey i asked the ska question from an hour or so ago. man i gotta talk this out, i hope you will listen because it feels important to me and i want to get your thoughts. i used to LOVE ska. streetlight manifesto was probably my first musical love. yet nobody else in my rural community seemed to like them very much. my mom called my music "mariachi music" which upset me, because her deliberate mischaracterization showed me the lack of care she had for what i liked, and that the music didn't resonate with her, so she belittled it.

     are you belittling mariachi music

     my dad never jived with it. nor did my siblings. my friends didn't like it at all, either, calling it too manic. so whenever i tried to share this music with anybody i liked i would get frustrated and embarrassed. i eventually stopped listening to it. years later i figured i had just grown out of it, some weird ska phase in my life in my angsty and misguided years. but recently i've been listening to a lot of ska. and i realiz ed, fuck it, i love this stuff. and everyone else is actually the weird one. this music speaks to me in ways that other music just does not really. i'm pissed that i was talked out of a love of mine. and now that i'm reclaiming this, i'm faced with the same challenge. i want to share this love but i feel so alone.

     find people online who like the same stuff you do. youtube, reddit, many other places

      how can i help people i care about feel what this music makes me feel?

     that's probably not a good strategy. you have a long lasting personal connection to the music, you can't just make someone have the same connection instantly. everyone is on their own unique musical journey. surely your dad, mom, siblings, all have their own music collections which they feel deeply attached to. do you think they could convince you to suddenly feel what they feel, for their music

     i gotta spread this joy or i get irritated

3.24.18  7:23 am   What are you doing for VidCon?

     i have no idea

      I saw the featured creators video on Twitter and almost screamed when I saw your face. will you be doing a panel?

     i have no idea. i have to figure that out today probably. i have to reply to the thing by monday, and i'm afraid my response is not going to be very cooperative

     you must have good snipsmanship
